children.text: The slab has been fully checked in all areas, and we can confirm that the slab beams appear to not have been properly vibrated/compacted, and there are no areas of honeycombing visible.
Part 3.2.3.1 Concrete of the BCA requires that
‘Concrete must be placed, compacted and cured in accordance with good building practice’
, while the relevant Australian Standard AS 2870 Residential Slabs and Footings requires that
‘Concrete in beams shall be mechanically vibrated’ .
This item is to confirm that the slab edge beams appear to have been properly vibrated/compacted, and there is no action required from the builder at this stage in relation to this issue.
